page.title: 06PRIMARY SCHOOLS (5 - 11 YRS)
page.content: Leyburn County Primary School is at least 130 years old. There are four classrooms in the main building and another three temporary classrooms in the grounds. Children come to the school from Hauxwell, Wensley, Preston-under-Scaur, Barden and Downholme. A{new school}is being built to replace the present building. It is situated in{Wensleydale Avenue.}The schools at Bellerby, Redmire and West Witton will close when the new building is finished and the pupils will travel by bus to the {new}Leyburn County Primary School. There is a small {Roman Catholic} primary school in Richmond Road. It has 50 pupils. The buildings are very old. Children from a wide area attend the school because of religious needs.
